intro: Salacia denudata, commonly known as the naked salacia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Saluraceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are fleshy berries that turn red when mature, containing several seeds. Salacia denudata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
